intro: Erigeron asper var. pubescens, commonly known as the rough hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy, rough stems and leaves. The plant produces daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white to pale pink petals. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and roadsides. Its pubescent (hairy) texture is a distinguishing feature of this variant.
